What we did Working principles

Business partner observations

Business partner observation #1

BPs have to spend a lot of time making the connections and links between risk and controls across business areas.

Business partner observation #2

Risk colleagues find sharing how they manage risk hard and daunting, necessitating BPs to act as guides and interpreters.

Business partner observation #3

The tools we provide for Risk colleagues make it hard for BPs to review and challenge.

Business partner observation #4

The Risk Register in particular inhibits Risk colleagues in sharing how they manage risk.

Business partner observation #5

Risk colleagues customise the registers to suit their needs.

Business partner observation #6

Risk colleagues find central Risk Management language hard to understand.

Business partner observation #7

Risk colleagues don’t see the benefit of a 'One Co-op' risk management process.

Business partner observation #8

Most business areas believe they manage their own risks adequately.

Business partner observation #9

Some risk colleagues are tired of changes that haven’t improved things.

Business partner observation #10

When Risk colleagues are looking at a risk rating they need to be able to see what it relates to.

Business partner observation #11

It is possible for BPs to see how business areas manage risk without those areas feeling they are 'doing their Risk Management'
